text.0: agni is set upon the earth well kindled he standeth in the presence of all beings.
text.1: wise ancient god the priest and purifier let agni serve the gods for he is worthy.
text.2: may narāśaṁsa lighting up the chambers bright in his majesty through threefold heaven.
text.3: steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose bedew the gods at chiefest time of worship.
text.4: adored in heart as is thy right o agni serve the gods first today before the mortal.
text.5: bring thou the marut host ye men do worship to indra seated on the grass eternal.
text.6: o grass divine increasing rich in heroes strewn for wealths sake well laid upon this altar.
text.7: on this bedewed with oil sit ye o vasus sit all ye gods ye holy ye Ādityas.
text.8: wide be the doors the goddesses thrown open easy to pass invoked through adorations.
text.9: let them unfold expansive everlasting that sanctify the class famed rich in heroes.
text.10: good work for us the glorious night and morning like female weavers waxen from aforetime.
text.11: yielders of rich milk interweave in concert the longextended thread the web of worship.
text.12: let the two heavenly heralds first most wise most fair present oblation duly with the sacred verse.
text.13: worshipping god at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.
text.14: sarasvatī who perfects our devotion iḷā divine bhāratī all surpassing.
text.15: three goddesses with power inherent seated protect this holy grass our flawless refuge.
text.16: born is the pious hero swift of hearing like gold in hue well formed and full of vigour.
text.17: may tvaṣṭar lengthen our line and kindred and may they reach the place which gods inhabit.
text.18: vanaspati shall stand anear and start us and agni with his arts prepare oblation.
text.19: let the skilled heavenly immolator forward unto the gods the offering thrice anointed.
text.20: oil has been mixt oil is his habitation in oil he rests oil is his proper province.
text.21: come as thy wont is o thou steer rejoice thee bear off the oblation duly consecrated.
